result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dezmond T Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court.  Attorney Justin Padway in court for Dezmond T Lewis.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests jury trial and final pretrial dates be set.  Case to be heard with Co-Defendant case 22CF1247.  Court sets the deadline of 1/30/2023 for filing of Jury Instructions, Motions in Limine, Witness lists and Change of Plea forms.  Court Orders State to provide crime lab report prior to final pretrial hearing.  Matter adjourned to Br. 9.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court.  Attorney Justin Padway in court for Dezmond T Lewis.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Pretrial Conference  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests additional time to allow for possible resolution.  Request granted. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court down on 8/26/2022.  Pursuant to agreement of counsel, the Pre-trial Conference set for 8/26/2022 at 2 pm is rescheduled to 8/30/2022 at 2 pm.

Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court with attorney Justin Padway.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dezmond T Lewis appeared by video means with Attorney. Court sets 07/08/2022 as the deadline for all discovery with the exception of crime lab reports to be turned over to defense. Court sets 08/22/2022 as the deadline for filing any motions or change of plea forms.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court with attorney Justin Padway.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed 05/24/2022. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty. Case is adjourned to tag along with co-defendant's case in Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff 04/03/22
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff 04/03/22
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 04/03/2022.

Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court with attorney Justin Padway.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer W. Schlicke.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense request an arrignment date. Court ordered case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders  balance of bail to be returned.   
 Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dezmond T Lewis in court with Attorney Justin Padway.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 5/16/22 @ 1p
